message_1:
In a group of 50 students, 25 are taking algebra, 20 are taking geometry, and 15 are taking both. 
How many students are taking at least one of these subjects?
message_2:
To find the number of students taking at least one of these subjects, we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion. 

The total number of students taking algebra or geometry is the sum of the number of students taking each subject minus the number of students taking both subjects (to avoid double-counting those students).

So, the number of students taking at least one of these subjects is:

25 (algebra) + 20 (geometry) - 15 (both) = 30 students.
